message.entry: Unable to apply method ''{0}'' to data variable {1}.
Invalid grouping variables.
Grouping variables function handle must return a logical scalar.
Invalid data variables.
Data variables function handle must return a logical scalar.
Number of elements in each data variables cell must be the same or 1.
Method must return one array whose first dimension has length 1 for each data group.
First argument must be a vector, matrix, cell array, table, or timetable.
When the first argument is a cell array, each cell element must contain matrices with the same number of columns or a single vector.
When the first argument is a cell array, each cell element must contain matrices with the same number of rows.
Grouping variables and data matrix must have same number of rows.
Grouping variable cannot be specified as a function handle.
Unable to apply method ''{0}'' to data column {1}.
Must specify a method when first argument is a vector or matrix.
Unable to concatenate results from applying specified methods to data columns.
Method must return a scalar per group.
Invalid binning scheme.
The number of binning schemes must be compatible with the number of grouping variables.
Binning scheme is not supported when grouping variable is empty.
Unable to apply binning method ''{0}'' to grouping variable ''{1}''.
Unable to apply binning method to grouping variable ''{0}''.
Unable to apply binning method to all grouping variables. Use a cell array or string array to specify a binning method for each grouping variable, with 'none' to indicate no binning.
Method must be a valid name, a function handle, or a cell array containing valid methods.
Parameter name must be ''IncludeMissingGroups'', ''IncludeEmptyGroups'', or ''IncludedEdge''.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Parameter names and values must occur in pairs.
''IncludedEdge'' is only supported when binning scheme is specified.
Character array data is not supported for the ''median'' method.
Data variable must be column vector for the ''numunique'' method.
Grouping variables must be constant for code generation when the first input argument is a table.
Binning scheme for datetime or duration data is not supported for code generation.
''IncludeMissingGroups'' value must be constant for code generation.
''IncludeEmptyGroups'' value must be constant for code generation.
''IncludedEdge'' value must be constant for code generation.
Variable-sized cell array inputs are not supported for code generation.
Function handle data variables are not supported for code generation.
Cell arrays of characters are not supported as the first input argument for code generation.
Computation method must be constant for code generation.
Data variables must be constant for code generation.
When the binning method is a character vector, string, or cell array of character vectors, it must be constant for code generation.
Computation methods returning an N-dimensional output are not supported for code generation.
Computation methods returning a sparse output are not supported for code generation.
Computation methods returning cell arrays are not supported for code generation.
